Source code for fluxpyt.glpk_solve

# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""
Created on Sun Aug  7 12:37:26 2016

@author: Trunil
"""
from fluxpyt.utility import size
import os
from collections import namedtuple #http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35988/c-like-structures-in-python
import sys


[docs]def glpk_solve(mat,c,b,bounds,rxnNames,maximize=False):
#    print('\n\n\nrunning glpk_solve...\n')
    
    
    if maximize == False:
        obj = 'Minimize'
    elif maximize == True:
        obj = 'Maximize'
    else:
        print('objective sense given is incorrect. It should be either maximize or minimize.')
        sys.exit()
        
   
    
    #open file in writing mode
    with open("model.lp", "w") as model:
        #write objective
        model.write(obj + '\n')
        line = 'obj: '
        started = False
        for i in range(len(c)):
            if c[i] == 0:
                continue
            
            if started == False:
                line += str(c[i]) + ' ' + rxnNames[i] + ' '
                started = True
            else:
                line += '+ ' + str(c[i]) + ' ' + rxnNames[i] + ' '
            if len(line) > 220: #max character in one line = 255. 220 selected for safety
                line += '\n'               
                model.write(line)
                line = ''
        model.write(line + '\n')
        
        #write constraints
        model.write('Subject To \n')
        [nrows,ncols] = size(mat)
        for j in range(nrows):
            constr_name = ('c' + str(j+1))
            vec = mat[j]
            write_constraint(constr_name,vec,rxnNames,model)
            
        #write bounds
        model.write('Bounds \n')
        for j in range(len(bounds)):
            lb = str(round(bounds[j][0],4))
            ub = str(round(bounds[j][1],4))
            model.write(lb + ' <= ' + rxnNames[j] + ' <= ' + ub + '\n')
         
        model.write('End')
        
    
        
    os.system('glpsol --cpxlp model.lp -o output.txt')

    
    
    
    solution = parse_output('output.txt',rxnNames)
    
    #sys.exit()
    model.close()
    
    return solution

    

    

[docs]def write_constraint(constr_name,vec,rxnNames,model):
    line = constr_name + ': '    
    started = False
    for i in range(len(vec)):
        if vec[i] == 0:
            continue
        
        if started == False:
            line += str(vec[i]) + ' ' + rxnNames[i] + ' '
            started = True
        else:
            if vec[i] > 0:
                line += '+ ' + str(vec[i]) + ' ' + rxnNames[i] + ' '
            elif vec[i] < 0:
                line += str(vec[i]) + ' ' + rxnNames[i] + ' '
        if len(line) > 220: #max character in one line = 255. 220 selected for safety
            line += '\n'               
            model.write(line)
            line = ''
    model.write(line + '= 0\n')

    

[docs]def parse_output(fileName,rxnNames):
    
    solutionStruct = namedtuple('solution','objective status x')
    
    with open(fileName, "r") as result:
        #print('\n\n')
        
        reactions = []
        fluxes = []
        for line in result.readlines():
            l = line.split()
            if 'obj' in l:
                objective = float(l[3])
               
            elif 'Status:' in l:
                status = l[1]
                
            elif len(l) > 3 and l[1] in rxnNames:
                reactions.append(l[1])
                fluxes.append(l[3])
        
        x = [reactions,fluxes]
                
        solution = solutionStruct(objective,status,x)            
    
    result.close()
    return solution
